org.jasig.cas.support.spnego.web.flow

Class SpnegoNegociateCredentialsAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.webflow.action.AbstractAction
      • org.jasig.cas.support.spnego.web.flow.SpnegoNegociateCredentialsAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.webflow.execution.Action

    @Component(value="negociateSpnego")
public final class SpnegoNegociateCredentialsAction
extends org.springframework.webflow.action.AbstractAction
    First action of a SPNEGO flow : negotiation.

    The server checks if the negotiation string is in the request header and this is a supported browser:

    • If found do nothing and return success()
    • else add a WWW-Authenticate response header and a 401 response status, then return success()
    Since:
    3.1
    See Also:
    RFC 4559

      • SpnegoNegociateCredentialsAction

        public SpnegoNegociateCredentialsAction()
        Instantiates a new Spnego negociate credentials action. Also initializes the list of supported browser user agents with the following:
        • MSIE
        • Trident
        • Firefox
        • AppleWebKit

      • setSupportedBrowser

        public void setSupportedBrowser(java.util.List<java.lang.String> supportedBrowser)
        Sets supported browsers by their user agent. The user agent header defined by SpnegoConstants.HEADER_USER_AGENT will be compared against this list. The user agents configured here need not be an exact match. So longer is the user agent identifier configured in this list is "found" in the user agent header retrieved, the check will pass.
        Parameters:
        supportedBrowser - the supported browsers list

      • setMixedModeAuthentication

        public void setMixedModeAuthentication(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether mixed mode authentication should be enabled. If it is enabled then control is allowed to pass back to the Spring Webflow instead of immediately terminating the page after issuing the unauthorized (401) header. This has the effect of displaying the login page on unsupported/configured browsers.

        If this is set to false then the page is immediately closed after the unauthorized header is sent. This is ideal in environments that only want to use Windows Integrated Auth/SPNEGO and not forms auth.

        Parameters:
        enabled - should mixed mode authentication be allowed. Default is false.

      • constructMessagePrefix

        protected java.lang.String constructMessagePrefix()
        Construct message prefix.
        Returns:
        if ntlm is enabled, SpnegoConstants.NTLM, otherwise SpnegoConstants.NEGOTIATE. An extra space is appended to the end.

      • isSupportedBrowser

        protected boolean isSupportedBrowser(java.lang.String userAgent)
        Checks if is supported browser.
        Parameters:
        userAgent - the user agent
        Returns:
        true, if supported browser
